answers.answer: No, there isn't anything you take as a substitute for thyroid med.  Many "side effects" of the med are actually those of hypothyroidism.  Being hypo can cause some of the symptoms of RA, such as the joint/muscle aches, etc.Some people do react to fillers/binders/dyes in the levo.  Have you tried a different manufacturer?  Each manufacturer uses different fillers/binders, so you might find one that doesn't have those effects.All of that said, what are your actual thyroid hormone levels?  You should be tested regularly for Free T3, Free T4 and TSH.  Please post your actual levels and be sure to include reference ranges, which vary lab to lab and have to come from your own report.

The synthetic levothyroxine in the pills is identical to that which your body would make if it could, and levothyroxine, itself, doesn't work fast enough for you to have a reaction within hours, unless you're reacting to fillers/binders/dyes.  The T4 in your system today is from that you took, at least, a couple weeks or more ago.The active ingredients in synthetic T3 and T4 are very different from each other and it's high unlikely, to nearly impossible for you to be allergic to both active ingredients.I'm assuming that "thyroid extract" is desiccated hormone containing both T4 and T3?  If so, that's made from pig thyroid and is not the same as human thyroid hormones, though some people do much better on it than they do on synthetics. Again, the T4 doesn't work fast enough for you have a reaction within hours of taking it.If you'll post your current thyroid hormone levels, maybe we can help shed some light on the situation.  Be sure to include reference ranges with any labs, as ranges vary lab to lab and have to come from your own report.In addition, do you know if you have Hashimoto's Thyroiditis?

question: For years now I have had side effects to thyroid meds but didn't realise it was the meds causing the problems.  They became severe in 2010 and I was dxd with rheumatoid arthritis but have since figured out that it is BOTH t4 and T3 that causes the problem.  It also causes me to have burning skin.  These symptoms are so severe I cannot take even small amounts of T4 or T3.  I have tried all forms - synthetic and nth - together and separate.  All have this effect on me.  Is there anything I can do or take as a substitute for thyroid meds?
title: Sensitive/Allergic to Thyroid Meds
